results.title: Stir
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Richard Brennan, New South Wales Film Corporation and Smiley Films
results.brief_description: A tense, realistic Australian drama which examines the barbarity and cruelty that exists within an Australian jail for male prisoners. Bryan Brown stars as a young but experienced convict determined to protest against the mindless, and often dehumanising, rules and limitations placed on prisoners. The script-writer, Bob Jewson, was a prisoner at Bathurst Goal in 1974 and he has based his script for “Stir” on the events and personalities which led to the infamous rioting at that institution. “Stir” culminates in a similar explosive finish. Cast also includes Max Phipps, Dennis Miller, Gary Waddell, Phil Motherwell, Edward Robshaw, Michael Gow and Robert ‘Tex’ Morton. Written by Bob Jewson. Photography by Geoff Burton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Wallace, Richard Brennan, New South Wales Film Corporation and Smiley Films

results.title: Steps of the ballet
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the creation of a ballet. The basic positions, movements and steps are demonstrated. The dancers’ steps are explained by Robert Helpmann, famous ballet dancer and choreographer. The film ends with the presentation of a new ballet to show how the arts of dancing, music and painting join together in its creation. Featured dancers include Alexander Grant (New Zealand), Elaine Fifield, Gordon Hamilton (Australia), Gerd Larsen, Peter Wright (United Kingdom), with Joan Harris (United Kingdom) as Ballet Mistress. Narrated by Robert Helpmann.

results.title: Still killing us softly
results.creator_credit: Margaret Margaret Lazarus and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: In this program, Jean Kilbourne examines images in advertising. She explores the relationship of media images to actual problems in society, such as the channelling of men and women into traditional roles and occupations, economic discrimination against women, the sexual abuse of children, rape and other forms of violence, pornography, sexual harassment, teenage pregnancy and eating disorders.

results.title: Stephane Grappelli in Concert
results.brief_description: Filmed at the Dallas Brookes Hall, Melbourne, on 26th August 1975. At 75 years of age and with a career spanning more than 60 years, Stephane Grappelli is considered the world’s greatest living jazz violinist. This concert features Grappelli with the Diz Disley Trio.

results.title: Still in one piece anyway
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, Rex Tasker, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film follows the Takaoka Maru, an enormous super-tanker carrying 1.5 million barrels of oil, as it ponderously winds its way through the Canso Strait to the oil refinery at Chedabucto Bay. It captures the intricate drama of docking and unloading the amount of oil Canada consumes in one day. Through an artful mixture of special sound effects, expressive photography, music and commentary, the film speaks both in awe, and in fear, of this creature of man’s making. A powerful documentary of a most unusual sort. Photographed by Les Krizsan and Barry Perles. Edited by Jy Chiperzak and Bruce Mackay. Sound by Raymond Marcoux and Bernie Bordeleau

results.title: Stigma
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a young woman who suffers a mental breakdown, recovers fully in a mental hospital and returns home. Instead of the understanding and support she most needs from her friends and associates, she is virtually ostracized. The film makes a plea for a change in the sort of public thinking that places a stigma upon people who have suffered from an illness of the mind rather than of the body. Cast includes Martha Choquette, Mickey Martin, Stanley Mellough, Marie-Louisa Holtz, Monique Chabot, Benoit Gerard.

results.title: Stargate for Game Boy
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Ra, the vicious alien ruler of Abydos, is using Stargates find resource-rich worlds to conquer and enslave its inhabitants. Only the player can stop Ra by cracking the Stargates’ codes and closing them before they can be misused. Stargate, while based on the action sci-fi franchise, is a matching puzzle game, similar to Tetris but with a 3D aspect. Tiles are dropped into a Stargate and matching three tiles with the same symbol clears the tiles. The game is lost when too many tiles fill up the space.

Adding complexity is the “address”, a set of seven symbols across the top of the screen that the player must clear by stacking three tiles of that symbol. The game features two modes. Skill Mode has the player clearing addresses before the tiles fill up. The game’s speed increases as more and more addresses are cleared. In Battle Mode, a player can play against the computer or another player via a link cable to another handheld. Clearing stacks adds them to your opponent’s field, hopefully overwhelming them and winning the match.

results.title: Steve Waugh
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Australian Cricket Video
results.brief_description: Australia’s tenth Test captain, Steve Waugh, carries some 14 years experience at cricket’s highest level. Only Alan Border has scored more Test runs for Australia, and no-one has played more one-day internationals. A hero at home, a world beater away, the feats of Steve Waugh have become legend the world over. This is an exceptional insight into the story of a great sportsman in his own words.

results.title: Steve Mcqueen Man on the Edge
results.brief_description: An acknowledged star, he was also an intensely private man. Despite accolades and huge earnings in his own mind he remained a street kid who made it. This film includes clips from his greatest films, never-before-seen home movies and interviews with directors, producers, agents, fellow actors, friends and family members.

results.title: Guido
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, Moira Ferguson and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Top end”.
Engineer Guido Zuccoli was born in Northern Italy in 1940 and migrated to Australia in 1961. The owner of a large and successful Darwin-based construction company, Guido claims “my work is my first hobby”. But Guido has another hobby about which he is passionate - aircraft. Guido first took up flying to commute easily between far-flung engineering projects in the Territory, but he began to practice daring aerobatics and has won the Australian championship many times. Plagued in his mid-forties by the headaches which signal the end of a career in competititve aerobatics, he purchased and restored three 1947 Hawker Sea Fury fighter planes to continue the “pure joy” he finds in his aircraft.
